description: Numbers n such that tau(n) (or sigma_0(n)) = phi(n).
comments: Numbers satisfying A000005(n)=A000010(n)This sequence is complete because tau(n) < n^(2/3) for all n except a few small numbers, whereas phi(n) > n/(exp(gamma) * log(log(n)) + 3/(log(log(n))) for n > 2. log(log(n)) grows slowly, so phi(n) > tau(n) for all n > some relatively small constant. [Jud McCranie, Jun 17 2005]Subset of A112587. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Sep 14 2005
mathematica: k=1; s=Select[ Range[ 1, 100000 ], Equal[ Sign[ DivisorSigma[ k-1, # ]-EulerPhi[ # ]^k ], 0 ]& ]
author: _David W. Wilson_
